rooms.description: An expansive open-plan area featuring a spacious living room that seamlessly connects to the entrance hall. The design incorporates large windows and sliding glass doors for natural light, aligning with Vastu principles by ensuring an inviting and balanced energy flow.

A modern kitchen integrated into the living space with an island counter for preparation. Natural light is maximized through strategically placed windows, and ventilation fans are installed to maintain good air circulation.
The master bedroom features ample natural light from east-facing windows, ensuring positive energy. It is designed with a private balcony for ventilation and relaxation.

A dedicated home office space on the ground floor that includes built-in storage, ergonomic seating, and a north-facing window for balanced light. The design follows Vastu guidelines to promote productivity.
A modern bathroom with an emphasis on efficient water usage and natural lighting. The layout considers privacy while ensuring proper ventilation.
Space allocated for household storage, laundry, and other utilities. Designed with access to natural light and adequate ventilation.
A comfortable guest bedroom with south-facing windows for enhanced lighting, adhering to Vastu principles of balance and harmony.
An extra bedroom providing flexibility in use. It incorporates natural light and proper ventilation, following Vastu guidelines for family harmony.
A secondary home office on the upper floor ensuring workspace separation from living areas, with east-facing windows for balanced energy.
An open balcony space extending from the master bedroom providing additional outdoor seating and improved ventilation, designed in a Brutalist style with raw concrete finishes.
Additional storage spaces integrated within walls for efficient space utilization, following Vastu principles of decluttering energy.

openings.description: Large windows to maximize morning light and enhance ventilation.
Windows for evening light, ensuring balanced exposure.
A robust, heavy-duty door in line with Brutalist aesthetics that enhances security and aligns with Vastu entry principles.
Sliding glass doors connecting the interior living space to the outdoor balcony for seamless transition.

notes: The design is conceptual and intended for a Brutalist duplex apartment layout on a 100x100 feet plot. Vastu principles are applied throughout, emphasizing natural light, ventilation, and balanced energy flow.
Please consult with certified architects and local building authorities to ensure compliance with regional norms and regulations.
